pageContext.claim: “Under this framework, the first $12,000 for a single individual and the first $24,000 for a married couple will be absolutely tax free -- no tax.”
pageContext.analysis: A couple with two children already “don’t pay a dime” on their first $28,800. That’s because they get $12,600 in a standard deduction and $16,200 in dependent and personal exemptions. It’s possible Trump’s expanded child tax credit might help make up some of the difference, but maybe not.
